s1: A practically oriented introduction to programming paradigms for parallel computers.
Considers definitions of program efficiency on parallel computers, addresses the modelling, analysis and measurement of program performance.
s2: Conceptual system design: including problem definition, technical performance measures, quality function deployment (QFD), trade-off analyses, and system specification.

s1: Description, implementation and use of parallel programming languages, parallel features of operating systems, library routines and applications.
s2: Conceptual system design: including problem definition, technical performance measures, quality function deployment (QFD), trade-off analyses, and system specification.

s1: Be proficient at programming multiple parallel machines in more than one special programming language or programming system.
s2: Because software is a critical component of such systems, Software Engineers will often work in Systems Engineering teams.

s1: Be able to descriptively compare the performance of different programs and methods on one machine
s2: Conceptual system design: including problem definition, technical performance measures, quality function deployment (QFD), trade-off analyses, and system specification.

s1: Demonstrate advanced knowledge of the elements of parallel programming language and system implementation.

s1: Recall the history of parallel systems and describe the developments in the field.
